intro: Ceropegia aloicola, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky substrates. Its flowers are typically pale green or white, with a unique structure that resembles a ghostly form, hence its common name. Ceropegia aloicola is adapted to withstand drought and requires minimal water once established.
